document_data.name: Mama Falice
document_data.mainbody:
'''Mama Falice''' was a refugee guest of [[Nortale's Hostel]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{Quote|Gods, I miss fresh air. Never dreamed I'd bring my family to a place like this.|Mama Falice}}
document_data.Description: Falice was a [[human]] woman with a light skin tone, mousy light brown hair, and dark brown eyes. She wore the humble garb of a commoner.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, as the [[Absolute crisis]] ravaged the [[Western Heartlands]], the city of Baldur's Gate became flooded with refugees. Mama Falice and her family were lucky enough to secure lodgings at Nortale's Hostel, which offered beds to the refugees but had very limited capacity. As the conflict continued to ravage the [[Chionthar Valley]], Falice lamented the events that led her family into Baldur's Gate and often missed fresh air, being cooped up in a crowded hostel.
